0.text: Bug 13661  Labels and widgets too far apart in preference pages.

3.text: Open Java->Editor or Java->Compiler  The widgets used to select options (Combo boxes or color selection boxes) are  right-aligned, and the labels are left aligned, leaving a large space between.

4.text: This problem is magnified if the user opens a page that is wider than the  default width, "stretching" the preference page dialog box.

5.text: It takes more than  a glance for the user to realize which labels line up with which widgets.

6.text: See the Ant->Console page for an example of a better layout.

7.text: In Ant->Console,  the widgets are aligned, but appear closer to their labels.
